alert.note: Alert for Western Alachua (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 21 at 2:47AM EDT until June 22 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of northeast Florida and north central Florida, including the following areas, in northeast Florida, Eastern Putnam and Western Putnam. In north central Florida, Central Marion, Eastern Alachua, Eastern Marion, Gilchrist, Western Alachua and Western Marion. * WHEN...Through Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - The National Weather Service in Jacksonville has extended a Flood Watch for portions of north central and northeast Florida. Additional rainfall amounts of 3 to 6 inches is forecast through Thursday, with locally higher totals possible. These heavy rainfall amounts over saturated soil conditions may lead to flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
